meanings.definition: The quality of being easy or enjoyable to read.
meanings.sent1: The readability of the book made it a joy to read.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the readability of this article; it's so easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: The readability of the menu was so good that even a cat could read it!
meanings.sent4: Her writing had a readability that shone brightly among the sea of complex texts.
meanings.sent5: The readability of the font was like a gentle breeze on a hot day, refreshing and welcoming.

meanings.definition: The ease with which a text can be read and understood.
meanings.sent1: The readability of the instructions was so clear that even a child could follow them.
meanings.sent2: I struggle with the readability of legal documents; they are so hard to understand.
meanings.sent3: The readability of the map was so poor that it led us in circles all day!
meanings.sent4: His speech had a readability that cut through the confusion like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The readability of the signs was like a beacon in the fog, guiding us safely home.
